Class EditProductController

    public class EditProductController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller for the add/modify product screens.
    Author:
    Zachary Mollenhour

      void onActionSavePart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Action event for saving a part Parses and validates form data for a partID and other part elements Creates staged product and saves it unless an error occurs in which it displays an alert Within this function, I encountered a troublesome logical error in line 197 I had initially written if product index is greater than 0 instead of greater than or equal to 0 which would cause issues to occur on the first part being modified as the inital value of the product index is -1 so when it added one to that the logic was invalid as it was not greater than 0
      void onKeySearchPart​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Member function to search for designated key Populates the key or displays a error if no key is found

      Perform updates on the view to that of an Add Product form.

      • startEdit

        public void startEdit​(int selectedIndex,
                      Product selectedProduct)
        Updates the view to that of an Edit Product form. This populates fields with information from an existing product.
        Parameters:
        selectedIndex - the index of the Product to edit.
        selectedProduct - the Product to edit.

      • onActionSavePart

        public void onActionSavePart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Action event for saving a part Parses and validates form data for a partID and other part elements Creates staged product and saves it unless an error occurs in which it displays an alert Within this function, I encountered a troublesome logical error in line 197 I had initially written if product index is greater than 0 instead of greater than or equal to 0 which would cause issues to occur on the first part being modified as the inital value of the product index is -1 so when it added one to that the logic was invalid as it was not greater than 0
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onActionCancel

        public void onActionCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Cancels changes to return to Main Screen. This checks with the user whether or not they want to discard their changes and go back.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - A user input event.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Initializes the EditProduct controller. Initializes the TableViews with initial contents and TableColumn/model associations.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
        resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.
